titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Daniel H. Basinger et al., Indictment
CWG0909

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
Breckenridge Circuit Court
Commonwealth of. Kentucky
against } Indictment
Daniel. H. ^B^asinger John. R. Bassinger and Lewis Baker

the grand Jury of Breckenridge County in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Daniel. H. Basinger John. R. Basinger & Lewis. Baker of the crime of murder committed as follows viz --

the Said Daniel. H. Basinger John. R. Basinger & Lewis Baker on the day of December & Year 1862 in the county afsd did feloniously and with mallas aforethought Kill and Murder Davis E Crawford by striking him with axes hammers & clubs against the peace & dignenty of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Information by Miss Angeline Baker Mrs Ann Tate Thomas Nichols & Sarah his wife John Thomas Samuel C. Crawford Amelia Ann Stuart Zachariah
T Witt Littleberry Dowell Felix Dowell Elizab Roberts Alexander Roberts Mrs Margaret Overton Lycurgus French & Wilson Jarrett Summons for the comlth -- Mrs Mary Ann Beard Clark Baker Benjamin. F. Allen & James A Turner

a copy att
G P Jolly clk

The within named Lewis Baker escaped from custody and is now at large I think a reward should be offored for his apprehension as the Murder charged in the Indictment was an atrocious assassination January 8th. 1864

Breckenridge Co
The Commonwealth. of. Ky
vs } Murder
Dan. H. Basinger
Jno R. Basinger
Lewis. Baker
A true Bill
Reward of $250.00 for Lewis Baker
Tho E Bramlette
11th Jany 1864
